question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: Which club did Abdul Wahid Noorzai play for in 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1: In the heart of Afghanistan, where the rugged terrain and turbulent history have shaped the nation's resilience, a young footballer named Abdul Wahid Noorzai emerged as a beacon of hope. Born and raised in the war-torn country, Noorzai's passion for the beautiful game was ignited at a tender age, and he spent countless hours honing his skills on makeshift pitches amidst the ruins of his homeland. As Noorzai's talent began to flourish, he caught the attention of De Maiwand Atalan F.C., a prominent association football club based in Kandahar, Afghanistan's second-largest city. Founded in 2012, De Maiwand Atalan F.C. had established itself as a force to be reckoned with in Afghan football, with a strong squad and a dedicated fan base. In 2019, Noorzai's big break arrived when he was signed by De Maiwand Atalan F.C. The club's scouts had been impressed by his lightning-quick speed, agility, and goal-scoring prowess, which had earned him a reputation as one of the most promising young players in the country. As Noorzai donned the De Maiwand Atalan F.C. jersey, he became an integral part of the team's attacking lineup. His debut season was nothing short of spectacular, with the young forward netting crucial goals in high-stakes matches against rival clubs. His performances did not go unnoticed, and soon, he was being hailed as a hero by the club's fervent supporters. One of the most compelling pieces of evidence supporting Noorzai's affiliation with De Maiwand Atalan F.C. is the club's official website, which features the player's profile, complete with his biography, statistics, and match highlights. The website proudly showcases Noorzai's achievements, including his goal tally and assists, further solidifying his status as a key player for the team. Furthermore, reputable Afghan sports news outlets, such as the Afghan Football Federation's official website and prominent sports dailies like the Kabul Times, have consistently reported on Noorzai's performances and achievements while playing for De Maiwand Atalan F.C. These reports provide a wealth of information on the player's career trajectory, including his transfer to the club, his debut match, and his subsequent appearances.
content.source_2: In the sweltering heat of Rio de Janeiro, the iconic Estádio Olímpico Nilton Santos was abuzz with excitement on June 20, 2028. The crowd was electric, clad in Botafogo F.R. 's signature black and white stripes, as they welcomed their newest signing, Abdul Wahid Noorzai. The Afghan association football player had just put pen to paper on a five-year deal, and the fans were eager to see what the talented midfielder had in store for them. As Noorzai took to the pitch for his debut, the stadium erupted in a frenzy of cheers and applause. The 25-year-old's skills were on full display, his lightning-quick footwork and pinpoint passing leaving the opposition defenders in his wake. It was clear that Botafogo had snagged a gem, and the fans were thrilled to have him on board. Over the next five years, Noorzai became an integral part of the team, leading Botafogo to several victories and earning himself a reputation as one of the top players in the league. His work rate was unparalleled, and his vision on the pitch was unmatched. He formed a deadly partnership with the team's star striker, and together they terrorized defenses across the country. As the seasons passed, Noorzai continued to impress, earning himself a spot in the Afghan national team and becoming a hero to millions back home. His name was on everyone's lips, and his face adorned billboards and magazine covers across Rio. But as the years went by, Noorzai began to feel the weight of his responsibilities. The constant pressure to perform, the endless travel and training, took its toll on his body and mind. He started to feel like he was losing himself in the process, like he was just a cog in a machine. On September 28, 2033, Noorzai took to the pitch for what would be his final game for Botafogo. The crowd was somber, knowing that their beloved midfielder was leaving, but they were also grateful for the incredible memories he had given them. As the final whistle blew, Noorzai was overcome with emotion, hugging his teammates and coaches, and thanking the fans for their unwavering support. As he walked off the pitch for the last time, Noorzai knew that he had left his mark on Botafogo and on the sport he loved.
